title: Ludwig reports that validation loss improved while it shows it to increase - confusing
body:
**Describe the bug**
@w4nderlust 

I am training a tagger [like in here](https://github.com/uber/ludwig/issues/729). I also specify class weights to force it to be more aggressive in assigning the class `X`. (to be honest I am not sure, if it takes effect)

```
(...)   
   loss:
      type: softmax_cross_entropy
      class_weights:
        X: 1.
        O: 0.02
```

What confuses me is that in the reports ludwig prints out I see the validation loss increase but ludwig reports that the loss improved (which I would assume would mean for it to decrese), saves the model and continues training. Does ludwig make the comparison on some different value than it prints out?

```
#  loss is in first numeric column

Epoch   8
────────────────┼──────────────┼─────────────────┤
│ vali              │ 0.0885 │     0.3998 │           0.9671 │          0.9530 │       1.0925 │          0.0347 │
├───────────────────┼────────┼────────────┼──────────────────┼
Validation loss on combined improved, model saved

Epoch   9
─────────────────┼──────────────┼─────────────────┤
│ vali              │ 0.0990 │     0.4143 │           0.9654 │          0.9542 │       1.1041 │          0.0363 │
├───────────────────┼────────┼────────────┼──────────────────┼ 
 Validation loss on combined improved, model saved

```

**To Reproduce**

I cannot provide the data I train on, but I observed it frequently, so maybe it can be seen on some other dataset you test on. I may try to provide synthetic data in the future, but maybe the problem can be diagnosed without it just looking at the code.


**Expected behavior**
Save the model and report improvement only when the validation loss truly decreses and it can be noticed in the console report.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
Centos7
 - Version [e.g. 22]
- Python version
3.6.8
- Ludwig version
current master

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
